goal: Propose a constitutional amendment to impose term limits on all members of Congress
Implement a hiring freeze on all federal employees to reduce federal workforce through attrition (exempting military, public safety, and public health)
summary: President Trump kicked off his first full week in office by signing three executive memorandums, including one hiring for some federal government workers as a way to reduce payrolls and rein in the size of the workforce.

goal: Require that for every new federal regulation, two existing regulations be eliminated
summary: Trump signed an executive order aimed at significantly cutting regulations. White House officials are calling the directive a “one in, two out” plan. It requires government agencies requesting a new regulations to identify two regulations they will cut from their own departments. (AP caption)

goal: Impose a five-year-ban on White House and congressional officials becoming lobbyists after they leave government service
summary: President Trump signed an executive order banning administration officials from ever lobbying the U.S. on behalf of a foreign government and imposing a separate five-year ban on other lobbying.

goal: Enforce a lifetime ban on White House officials lobbying on behalf of a foreign government
summary: President Trump signed an executive order banning administration officials from ever lobbying the U.S. on behalf of a foreign government and imposing a separate five-year ban on other lobbying.

goal: Ban foreign lobbyists from raising money for American elections
Renegotiate NAFTA or withdraw from the deal under Article 2205
summary: A draft of his administration’s plan for NAFTA proposes only a mild rewrite. But in his AP interview, he threatened anew to terminate the deal if his goals are not met in a renegotiation.

goal: Withdraw from the Trans-Pacific Partnership
summary: During his first week in office, Trump abandoned the 12-nation TransPacific Partnership brokered by former President Barack Obama. Many Washington companies participate in global trade.

goal: Direct the Secretary of the Treasury to label China a currency manipulator

Direct the Secretary of Commerce and U.S. Trade Representative to identify all foreign trading abuses that unfairly impact American workers and direct them to use every tool under American and international law to end those abuses immediately
Lift the restrictions on the production of $50 trillion dollars' worth of job-producing American energy reserves, including shale, oil, natural gas and clean coal.
Allow energy infrastructure projects, like the Keystone Pipeline, to move forward
summary: Trump signed executive actions to aggressively overhaul the country's energy policy, advancing the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipeline projects.

goal: Cancel billions in payments to U.N. climate change programs and use the money to fix America's water and environmental infrastructure
Cancel every executive action, memorandum and order issued by President Obama
Select a Supreme Court nominee
summary: In a move to replace the late Justice Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court, Trump nominated Neil Gorsuch, who has been confirmed, to the seat.

goal: Cancel all federal funding to Sanctuary Cities
summary: Less than a month after Seattle sued President Donald Trump over his “sanctuary cities” executive order, a federal judge in San Francisco has blocked the order. Seattle will now review that ruling, which will inform the city’s next steps in its own suit, Murray said.

goal: Begin removing the more than 2 million criminal illegal immigrants from the country and cancel visas to foreign countries that won't take them back
summary: Trump signed executive actions to jumpstart construction of a U.S.-Mexico border wall and order cuts in federal grants for "sanctuary cities."

goal: Suspend immigration from terror-prone regions where vetting cannot safely occur. All vetting of people coming into our country will be considered extreme vetting
summary: A three-judge federal appeals panel unanimously refused to reinstate President Trump’s targeted travel ban after it sparked protests throughout the country, including at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.

goal: Middle Class Tax Relief And Simplification Act
End The Offshoring Act
American Energy & Infrastructure Act
School Choice And Education Opportunity Act
Repeal and Replace Obamacare Act
summary: The first executive order signed by Trump aimed to repeal former President Obama's health care law. More than 200,000 King County residents are insured through the Affordable Care Act.

goal: Affordable Childcare and Eldercare Act
End Illegal Immigration Act
Restoring Community Safety Act
Restoring National Security Act
Clean up Corruption in Washington Act
summary: President Trump signed an executive order banning administration officials from ever lobbying the U.S. on behalf of a foreign government and imposing a separate five-year ban on other lobbying.
